pages.title: The Art of Brewing
pages.text: Fermentation is a very natural process - things take time and care. Since there never is a fully controlled environment there are a lot of variables:$(li)Time: It takes time for the barrel to influence the contents. The longer you give the process, the stronger the changes will be. Most beverages get more intense and even additional effects, when given more time than strictly required

$(li)Temperature: The hotter it is, the more of your precious content simply evaporates over time. This is called the Angel's Share$(li)Humidity: The more humid the air, the more water evaporates in comparison to alcohol, making the drink stronger$(li)Water Share: An increased rate of ingredients to water is a fine balance, but one to be played with. More thickness makes the drink ferment faster, albeit at the cost of shorter status effect durations

pages.title: Malt Beer
pages.text: Malt beer is both filling and tastes both sweet and savory. What a nice combination.

pages.title: Safety Question
pages.text: The $(thing)Titration Barrel$() is capable of brewing alcoholic drinks. If you are old enough to consume alcohol in your country, you can press the button below to unlock these recipes.$(br)If not don't worry - you won't miss anything important.

pages.title: Beers
pages.text: Additionally to Haste it can grant a bit of Saturation, depending on the time it fermented.
Just... don't brew them too long or they will shift and end up tasting awful.

pages.title: Rum
pages.text: Strong to the taste, made even more intense via the influence of the colored wood, grants $(thing)Absorption$() and $(thing)Resistance$().

pages.title: Mead
pages.text: The large amount of sugar in honey is perfect for fermentation. The result is a strong, although still sweet drink.

pages.title: Apple Cider
pages.text: Fermented apples, usually sweet and sparkly, with a slight note of sour - if you do not forget to tap it soon enough.

pages.title: Golden Ciders
pages.text: Way more potent than their common counterpart. Won't go bad over time and taste glorious for sure.

pages.title: Berry Cider
pages.text: A much more fruity cider than from apples. The glowy variant seems to ferment a bit quicker, but also... makes you glow. Hmm.

pages.title: Berry Liquor
pages.text: Berries can also be used for liquor. Way more viscous and sweet and stronger, but takes longer to ferment.

pages.title: Vodka
pages.text: Gets only stronger with age. Just one question: How deadly do you want it?

pages.title: Tequila
pages.text: Does only get stronger with age. Tastes like a bar fight.

pages.title: Pure Alcohol
pages.text: Your memory isn't always up to snuff. Somehow you ended up with this bottle. Definitely got a little stronger than planned...$(br)More to disinfect than to drink.
